content: the sipoo sweater is part of the sipoo collection made in collaboration with the adult education centre of sipoo inspired by the historical sipoo tapestry #sipoosweater this round yoke sweater is worked top-down with two- or three-color colorwork after which short row are used to improve the fit and additional raglan increases are worked for sizes l 5xl the sleeves are separated from the body and finished last the body can be shaped into a slight a-line with increases the look is completed with non-rolling stockinette edges sizes xs s m l xl 2xl 3xl 4xl 5xl recommended amount of positive ease 5-15 cm choose a size by measuring the widest part of your bust and adding the recommended ease to it the measurements can be found in the pictures note that all measurements in this pattern are provided in metric units materials the white sample vuonue pentti worsted 240 m/100 g 70% finnish wool 30% tencel main color white 400 400 450 450 500 500 550 600 600 g contrasting color 1 dark petrol 50 50 100 100 100 100 100 100 100 g contrasting color 2 light pink 50 50 50 50 100 100 100 100 100 g the black sample isager jensen yarn 250 m/100 g 100% wool main color 30 black 350 350 400 400 450 500 500 550 550 g contrasting color 0 white 100 100 100 100 150 150 150 150 150 g needles 3 mm circular needle with a 40-120 cm cable for the neckline hem and cuffs 4 mm circular needle with a 40-120 cm cable for the neckline body and sleeves 4 5 mm circular needle with a 40-100 cm cable for the colorwork or others to meet the gauge choose a cable length that suits your needs gauge 21 sts x 28 rnds = 10 cm x 10 cm stockinette in the round with 4 mm needles and colorwork in the round with 4 5 mm needles check the gauge by knitting a swatch in both stockinette and colorwork by following the chart notions stitch cables/scrap yarn stitch markers tapestry needle
